SENT.plain: Cerebrovascular moyamoya disease is a chronic occlusive disease of unknown etiology, 90% of which are found among Japanese
At the 3rd International Symposium on Microsurgical Anastomosis held in 1976, Kikuchi and Kawasawa reported an preventing effect of STA-MCA bypass surgery for ischemic episode of this disease

Thereafter, they proposed a new operation to place temporal muscle on the brain surface, namely Encephalo-Myo Synangiosis (EMS), for the patients lacking suitable recipient artery of middle cerebral artery territory
The authors report clinical experience of eight STA-MCA anastomosis, two STA-MCA anastomosis with EMS and one EMS performed on six cases with moyamoya disease
The follow up period after operation ranged from seven to 18 months
Four patients had excellent results, and one good
One died of subdural hematoma of non-operated side seven months after contralateral bypass procedure
STA-MCA bypass surgery is an effective treatment for moyamoya disease
Also, EMS is expected to be a replaceable surgical procedure for STA-MCA bypass under absence of suitable recipient artery
